label: thm-revival-guarantee
label_text: Almost‑sure revival under the global constraint
full_statement_text:
Assume the global constraint $\varepsilon_{\text{clone}}\,p_{\max} < \eta^{\alpha+\beta}$. Let $\mathcal S$ be any swarm with at least one alive walker ($|\mathcal A(\mathcal S)|\ge 1$) and let $i\in\mathcal D(\mathcal S)$ be dead. Then, under the cloning rule with threshold $T_{\text{clone}}\sim\mathrm{Unif}(0,p_{\max})$ and a per‑dead‑walker score $S_i$ computed from an alive companion as in §16.1, we have

$$
\mathbb P\big[\text{$i$ is revived in the cloning stage}\big] \;=\;1.
$$

In particular, $S_i > p_{\max}$ surely, hence $S_i > T_{\text{clone}}$ for every threshold realization. The conclusion holds also when $|\mathcal A(\mathcal S)|=1$ (single‑survivor case) since the companion selection measure assigns the unique alive index to every dead walker (cf. [](#def-companion-selection-measure)).
